BULBASAUR.description:
Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright
sunlight. There is a seed on its back.
By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed
grows progressively larger.

IVYSAUR.description:
To support its bulb, Ivysaur's legs
grow sturdy. If it spends more time lying in
the sunlight, the bud will soon bloom into
a large flower.

VENUSAUR.description:
Venusaur's flower is said to take on vivid
colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and
sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the
emotions of people.

MEGA.description: In order to support its flower, which\nhas grown larger due to Mega Evolution,\nits back and legs have become stronger.

GMAX.description:
Spits big amounts of pollen like a volcano.
Breathing too much of it causes fainting.
In battle, it swings around two thick vines
that can easily topple 10-story buildings.

CHARMANDER.description:
The flame that burns at the tip of its
tail is an indication of its emotions.
The flame wavers when Charmander is
happy, and blazes when it is enraged.

CHARMELEON.description:
Without pity, its sharp claws destroy foes.
If it encounters a strong enemy, it
becomes agitated, and the flame on its
tail flares with a bluish white color.

CHARIZARD.description:
A Charizard flies about in search of
strong opponents. It breathes intense
flames that can melt any material. However,
it will never torch a weaker foe.

MEGA_X.description: The overwhelming power that fills its\nentire body causes it to turn black\nand creates intense blue flames.

MEGA_Y.description:
Its bond with its Trainer is the source
of its power. It boasts speed and
maneuverability greater than that of a
jet fighter.

GMAX.description:
The flame inside its body burns
hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
When Charizard roars, that
temperature climbs even higher.

SQUIRTLE.description:
Its shell is not just for protection.
Its rounded shape and the grooves on its
surface minimize resistance in water,
enabling Squirtle to swim at high speeds.

WARTORTLE.description:
Its large tail is covered with rich, thick
fur that deepens in color with age.
The scratches on its shell are evidence
of this Pokémon's toughness in battle.

BLASTOISE.description:
The waterspouts that protrude from its
shell are highly accurate. Their bullets of
water can precisely nail tin cans from
a distance of over 160 feet.

MEGA.description:
The cannon on its back is as powerful
as a tank gun. Its tough legs and back
enable it to withstand the recoil from
firing the cannon.

GMAX.description:
It's not very good at precision
shooting. When attacking, it just fires
its 31 cannons over and over and
over.

CATERPIE.description:
Its voracious appetite compels it to
devour leaves bigger than itself without
hesitation. It releases a terribly strong
odor from its antennae.

METAPOD.description:
Its shell is as hard as an iron slab.
A Metapod does not move very much
because it is preparing its soft innards
for evolution inside the shell.

BUTTERFREE.description:
It has a superior ability to search for
delicious honey from flowers. It can seek,
extract, and carry honey from flowers
blooming over six miles away.

GMAX.description:
Once it has opponents trapped in a
tornado that could blow away a 10-
ton truck, it finishes them off with
its poisonous scales.

WEEDLE.description:
A Weedle has an extremely acute sense
of smell. It distinguishes its favorite
kinds of leaves from those it dislikes by
sniffing with its big red nose.

KAKUNA.description:
It remains virtually immobile while it
clings to a tree. However, on the inside,
it busily prepares for evolution. This is
evident from how hot its shell becomes.

BEEDRILL.description:
A Beedrill is extremely territorial.
For safety reasons, no one should ever
approach its nest. If angered, they will
attack in a swarm.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
198
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
178
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
173
#else
159
#endif

MEGA.description:
Its legs have become poison stingers.
It stabs its prey repeatedly with the
stingers on its limbs, dealing the final
blow with the stinger on its rear.

PIDGEY.description:
It has an extremely sharp sense of
direction. It can unerringly return home to
its nest, however far it may be removed
from its familiar surroundings.

PIDGEOTTO.description:
This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its
large territory. If its living space is
violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly
punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

PIDGEOT.description:
This Pokémon has gorgeous, glossy
feathers. Many Trainers are so captivated
by the beautiful feathers on its head that
they choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
240
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
216
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
211
#else
172
#endif

MEGA.description: With its muscular strength now greatly\nincreased, it can fly continuously\nfor two weeks without resting.

RATTATA.description:
A Rattata is cautious in the extreme.
Even while it is asleep, it constantly
moves its ears and listens for danger.
It will make its nest anywhere.

ALOLA.description:
With its incisors, it gnaws through doors
and infiltrates people's homes.
Then, with a twitch of its whiskers,
it steals whatever food it finds.

RATICATE.description:
A Raticate's sturdy fangs grow steadily.
To keep them ground down, it gnaws on
rocks and logs. It may even chew on the
walls of houses.

SPEAROW.description:
Its loud cry can be heard over half a mile
away. If its high, keening cry is heard
echoing all around, it is a sign that they
are warning each other of danger.

FEAROW.description:
Its long neck and elongated beak are
ideal for catching prey in soil or water.
It deftly moves this extended and skinny
beak to pluck prey.

EKANS.description:
An Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while
it rests. This position allows it to quickly
respond to an enemy from any direction
with a threat from its upraised head.

ARBOK.description:
This Pokémon has a terrifically strong
constricting power. It can even flatten
steel oil drums. Once it wraps its body
around its foe, escaping is impossible.

ORIGINAL.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed during adventures
across many different regions.

HOENN.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed during adventures
across the Hoenn region together.

SINNOH.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed during adventures
across the Sinnoh region together.

UNOVA.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed during adventures
across the Unova region together.

KALOS.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed during adventures
across the Kalos region together.

ALOLA.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed during adventures
across the Alola region together.

PARTNER.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed as the two overcame
many hardships together.

WORLD.description:
This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which
is proof of the strong bond Pikachu and
its partner formed during adventures
across the world together.

GMAX.description:
When it smashes its opponents with
its bolt-shaped tail, it delivers a
surge of electricity equivalent to a
lightning strike.

RAICHU.description:
If it stores too much electricity, its
behavior turns aggressive. To avoid this,
it occasionally discharges excess energy
and calms itself down.

ALOLA.description:
It uses psychokinesis to control
electricity. It focuses psychic energy
into its tail and rides it like it's surfing.
Another name for this Pokémon is 'hodad'.

SANDSHREW.description:
When it curls up in a ball, it can make any
attack bounce off harmlessly. Its hide has
turned tough and solid as a result of
living in the desert.

ALOLA.description:
Life on mountains covered with deep snow
has granted this Pokémon a body of ice
that's as hard as steel.
Predators go after its soft belly.

SANDSLASH.description:
It curls up in a ball to protect itself from
enemy attacks. It also curls up to prevent
heatstroke during the daytime when
temperatures rise sharply.

ALOLA.description:
It uses large, hooked claws to cut a path
through deep snow as it runs.
On snowy mountains, this Sandslash
is faster than any other Pokémon.

NIDORAN_F.description:
Its highly toxic barbs are thought to have
developed as protection for this small-
bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases
a horrible toxin from its horn.

NIDORINA.description:
When it is with its friends or
family, its barbs are tucked away to
prevent injury. It appears to become
nervous if separated from the others.

NIDOQUEEN.description:
It is adept at sending foes flying with
harsh tackles using its tough, scaly body.
This Pokémon is at its strongest when
it is defending its young.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
253
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
227
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
223
#else
194
#endif

NIDORAN_M.description:
The male Nidoran has developed muscles
that freely move its ears in any direction.
Even the slightest sound does not escape
this Pokémon's notice.

NIDORINO.description:
Its horn is harder than a diamond.
If it senses a hostile presence, all the
barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it
challenges the foe with all its might.

NIDOKING.description:
A Nidoking's thick tail packs enormously
destructive power capable of toppling
a metal transmission tower. Once it goes
on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
253
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
227
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
223
#else
195
#endif

CLEFFA.description:
On nights with many shooting stars,
Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring.
They dance until daybreak, when they
quench their thirst with the morning dew.

CLEFAIRY.description:
On every night of a full moon, they come
out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired
Clefairy go to sleep nestled up against
each other in deep and quiet mountains.

CLEFABLE.description:
A Clefable uses its wings to skip lightly 
as if it were flying. Its bouncy step
lets it even walk on water. On quiet,
moonlit nights, it strolls on lakes.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
242
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
217
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
213
#else
129
#endif

MEGA.description: It flies by using the power of\nmoonlight to control gravity within\na radius of over 32 feet around it.

VULPIX.description:
It can freely control fire, making fiery
orbs fly like will-o'-the-wisps. Just
before evolution, its six tails grow hot 
as if on fire.

ALOLA.description:
They live together in a skulk, helping
one another. In hot weather, this Pokémon
makes ice shards with its six tails and
sprays them around to cool itself off.

NINETALES.description:
It has long been said that each of the
nine tails embody an enchanted power.
A long-lived Ninetales will have fur that
shines like gold.

ALOLA.description:
While it will guide travelers who get lost
on a snowy mountain down to the
mountain's base, it won't forgive anyone
who harms nature.

IGGLYBUFF.description:
Its soft and pliable body is very bouncy.
When it sings continuously with all its
might, its body steadily turns a deepening
pink color.

JIGGLYPUFF.description:
Nothing can avoid falling asleep hearing a
Jigglypuff's song. The sound waves of its
singing voice match the brain waves of
someone in a deep sleep.

WIGGLYTUFF.description:
Its fur is the ultimate in luxuriousness.
Sleeping alongside a Wigglytuff is simply
divine. Its body expands seemingly without
end when it inhales.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
218
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
196
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
191
#else
109
#endif

ZUBAT.description:
While living in pitch-black caverns, their
eyes gradually grew shut and deprived
them of vision. They use ultrasonic waves
to detect obstacles.

GOLBAT.description:
Its fangs easily puncture even thick
animal hide. It loves to feast on the blood
of people and Pokémon. It flits about in
darkness and strikes from behind.

CROBAT.description:
Over the course of evolution, its hind legs
turned into wings. By alternately resting
its front and rear wings, it can fly all day
without having to stop.

ODDISH.description:
This Pokémon grows by absorbing moonlight.
During the daytime, it buries itself in the
ground, leaving only its leaves exposed to
avoid detection by its enemies.

GLOOM.description:
A horribly noxious honey drools from its
mouth. One whiff of the honey can result
in memory loss. Some fans are said to
enjoy this overwhelming stink, however.

VILEPLUME.description:
In seasons when it produces more pollen,
the air around a Vileplume turns yellow
with the powder as it walks. The pollen is
highly toxic and causes paralysis.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
245
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
221
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
216
#else
184
#endif

BELLOSSOM.description:
Its flower petals deepen in color through
exposure to sunlight. When cloudy weather
persists, it does a dance that is thought
to be a ritual for summoning the sun.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
245
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
221
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
216
#else
184
#endif

PARAS.description:
A Paras has parasitic tochukaso
mushrooms growing on its back. They grow
by drawing nutrients from the host. They
are valued as a medicine for long life.

PARASECT.description:
Parasect are known to infest the roots of
large trees en masse and drain nutrients.
When an infested tree dies, they move
onto another tree all at once.

VENONAT.description:
Its coat of thin, stiff hair that covers
its entire body is said to have evolved
for protection. Its large eyes never fail
to spot even miniscule prey.

VENOMOTH.description:
Venomoth are nocturnal--they are only
active at night. Their favorite prey are
insects that gather around streetlights,
attracted by the light in the darkness.

DIGLETT.description:
Diglett are raised in most farms.
The reason is simple--wherever they
burrow, the soil is left perfectly tilled
for growing delicious crops.

ALOLA.description:
The metal-rich geology of its habitat
caused it to develop steel whiskers on its
head that change shape depending on its
mood and when communicating with others.

DUGTRIO.description:
Because the triplets originally split from
one body, they think exactly alike.
They work cooperatively to burrow
endlessly through the ground.

ALOLA.description:
Their beautiful, metallic whiskers create
a sort of protective helmet on
heir heads, and they also function
as highly precise sensors.

MEOWTH.description:
Meowth withdraw their sharp claws into
their paws to silently sneak about.
For some reason, this Pokémon loves
shiny coins that glitter with light.

ALOLA.description:
It's accustomed to luxury because it used
to live with Alolan royalty. Highly smart
and proud, it's famously difficult to
handle, but that also makes it popular.

GALAR.description:
Living with a savage, seafaring people has
hardened its body so much that parts of it
turned to iron. Darker coins are harder
and garner more respect among Meowth.

GMAX.description:
The pattern that has appeared on
its giant coin is thought to be the
key to unlocking the secrets of the
Dynamax phenomenon.

PERSIAN.description:
A Persian's six bold whiskers sense air
movements to determine what is in its
vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed
by the whiskers.

ALOLA.description:
It looks down on everyone other than
itself. In contrast to its lovely face, it
is so brutal that it tortures its weakened
prey rather than finishing them off.

PERRSERKER.description: What appears to be an iron helmet is\nactually hardened hair. This Pokémon\nlives for the thrill of battle.

PSYDUCK.description:
When its headache intensifies, it starts
using strange powers. However, it has no
recollection of its powers, so it always
looks befuddled and bewildered.

GOLDUCK.description:
A Golduck is an adept swimmer.
It sometimes joins competitive swimmers
in training. It uses psychic powers when
its forehead shimmers with light.

MANKEY.description:
When it starts shaking and its nasal
breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign
of anger. However, since this happens
instantly, there is no time to flee.

PRIMEAPE.description:
When it becomes furious, its blood
circulation becomes more robust, and
its muscles are made stronger. But it
also becomes much less intelligent.

ANNIHILAPE.description:
When its anger rose beyond a
critical point, this Pokémon gained power
that is unfettered by the limits of
its physical body.

GROWLITHE.description:
Its superb sense of smell ensures that
this Pokémon won't forget any scent,
no matter what. It uses its sense of smell
to detect the emotions of others.

HISUI.description:
They patrol their territory in pairs.
It's believed the igneous rock components
in the fur of this species are the result
of volcanic activity in its habitat.

ARCANINE.description:
This fleet-footed Pokémon is said to run
over 6,200 miles in a single day and night.
The fire that blazes wildly within its body
is its source of power.

HISUI.description:
Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in
blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly
feints every which way, leading opponents
on a deceptively merry chase.

POLIWAG.description:
It is possible to see this Pokémon's spiral
innards right through its thin skin.
However, the skin is also very flexible.
Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.

POLIWHIRL.description:
Its body surface is always wet and slick
with an oily fluid. Because of this greasy
covering, it can easily slip and slide out
of the clutches of any enemy in battle.

POLIWRATH.description:
Its highly developed muscles never grow
fatigued, however much it exercises.
This Pokémon can swim back and forth
across the Pacific Ocean without effort.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
255
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
230
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
225
#else
185
#endif

POLITOED.description:
The curled hair on its head proves its
status as a king. It is said that the
longer and curlier the hair, the more
respect it earns from its peers.

ABRA.description:
A Pokémon that sleeps 18 hours a day.
Observation revealed that it uses
Teleport to change its location once
every hour.

KADABRA.description:
It is rumored that a boy with psychic
abilities suddenly transformed into
Kadabra while he was assisting research
into extrasensory powers.

ALAKAZAM.description:
While it has strong psychic abilities and
high intelligence, an Alakazam's muscles
are very weak. It uses psychic power to
move its body.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
250
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
225
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
221
#else
186
#endif

MEGA.description: Having traded away its muscles, Alakazam's\ntrue power has been unleashed. With its\npsychic powers, it can foresee all things.

MACHOP.description:
It continually undertakes strenuous
training to master all forms of martial
arts. Its strength lets it easily hoist
a sumo wrestler onto its shoulders.

MACHOKE.description:
A belt is worn by a Machoke to keep its
overwhelming power under control.
Because it is so dangerous, no one has
ever removed the belt.

MACHAMP.description:
It is impossible to defend against punches
and chops doled out by its four arms.
Its fighting spirit flares up when it faces
a tough opponent.

GMAX.description:
One of these Pokémon once used
its immeasurable strength to lift a
large ship that was in trouble. It
then carried the ship to port.

BELLSPROUT.description:
A Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets
it bend and sway to avoid any attack,
however strong it may be. From its mouth,
it leaks a fluid that melts even iron.

WEEPINBELL.description:
At night, a Weepinbell hangs on to a tree
branch with its hooked rear and sleeps.
If it moves around in its sleep, it may
wake up to find itself on the ground.

VICTREEBEL.description:
The long vine extending from its head is
waved about as if it were a living thing to
attract prey. When an unsuspecting victim
approaches, it is swallowed whole.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
245
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
221
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
216
#else
191
#endif

MEGA.description:
The volume of this Pokémon's acid
has increased due to Mega Evolution,
filling its mouth. If not careful,
the acid will overflow and spill out.

TENTACOOL.description:
Its body is almost entirely composed of
water. It ensnares its foe with its two
long tentacles, then stabs with the poison
stingers at their tips.

TENTACRUEL.description:
It lives in complex rock formations on
the ocean floor and traps prey using its
80 tentacles. Its red orbs glow when it
grows excited or agitated.

GEODUDE.description:
It climbs mountain paths using only the
power of its arms. Because they look just
like boulders lining paths, hikers may step
on them without noticing.

ALOLA.description:
Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand
attach to parts of its body with stronger
magnetism. If you carelessly step on one,
it will headbutt and shock you in anger.

GRAVELER.description:
They descend from mountains by tumbling
down steep slopes. They are so brutal,
they smash aside obstructing trees and
massive boulders with thunderous tackles.

ALOLA.description:
When two Graveler smash each other over
dravite, their favorite food, they cause
flashes of light and booming noises.
People call them “fireworks of the earth.”

GOLEM.description:
It is said to live in volcanic craters
on mountain peaks. Once a year, it sheds
its hide and grows larger. The shed hide
crumbles and returns to the soil.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
248
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
223
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
218
#else
177
#endif

ALOLA.description:
It fires rocks charged with electricity.
Even if the rock isn't fired that
accurately, just grazing an opponent
will cause numbness and fainting.

PONYTA.description:
A Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can
barely stand up. Its legs become stronger
as it stumbles and falls while trying to
keep up with its parent.

GALAR.description:
Its small horn hides a healing power.
This Pokémon will look into your eyes and
read the contents of your heart. If it
finds evil there, it promptly hides away.

RAPIDASH.description:
It usually canters casually in the fields
and plains. But once a Rapidash turns
serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze
as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.

GALAR.description:
Little can stand up to its psycho cut.
Unleashed from this Pokémon's horn,
the move will punch a hole right
through a thick metal sheet.

SLOWPOKE.description:
It catches prey by dipping its tail in
water at the side of a river. But it often
forgets what it is doing and spends entire
days just loafing at water's edge.

GALAR.description:
Although it is normally zoned out, its
expression abruptly sharpens on occasion.
The cause seems to lie in Slowpoke's diet,
which also give their tails a spicy flavor.

SLOWBRO.description:
Its tail has a Shellder firmly attached
with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be
used for fishing anymore. This forces it
to reluctantly swim and catch prey.

MEGA.description:
When bathed in the energy of Mega
Evolution, Shellder converts into
impregnable armor. There is virtually no
change in Slowpoke.

GALAR.description:
A Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction
with the spices inside Slowbro's body,
causing Slowbro to become a
Poison-type Pokémon.

SLOWKING.description:
It undertakes research every day to
solve the mysteries of the world.
However, it apparently forgets everything
if the Shellder on its head comes off.

GALAR.description:
A combination of toxins and the shock of
evolving has increased Shellder's
intelligence to the point that Shellder
now controls Slowking.

MAGNEMITE.description:
The units at its sides are extremely
powerful magnets. They generate enough
magnetism to draw in iron objects from
over 300 feet away.

MAGNETON.description:
It is actually three Magnemite linked
by magnetism. It generates powerful radio
waves that raise temperatures by 3.6
degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_4_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_LEVEL, 0, SPECIES_MAGNEZONE, CONDITIONS({IF_IN_MAPSEC, MAPSEC_NEW_MAUVILLE})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_THUNDER_STONE, SPECIES_MAGNEZONE})
#endif

MAGNEZONE.description:
As it zooms through the sky, this
Pokémon seems to be receiving signals
of unknown origin, while transmitting its
own signals of unknown purpose.

FARFETCHD.description:
It is always seen with a stick from a plant.
Apparently, there are good sticks and bad
sticks. This Pokémon occasionally fights
with others over choice sticks.

GALAR.description:
The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer
in the Galar region. Brave Farfetch'd
warriors that adapted to these stalks
took on a unique form.

SIRFETCHD.description:
Only Farfetch'd that have survived many
battles can attain this evolution. When
this Pokémon's leek withers, it will
retire from combat.

DODUO.description:
Even while eating or sleeping, one of the
heads remains always vigilant for any sign
of danger. When threatened, it flees at
over 60 miles per hour.

DODRIO.description:
A peculiar Pokémon species with three
heads. It vigorously races across grassy
plains even in arid seasons with little
rainfall.

SEEL.description:
Seel hunt for prey in frigid, ice-covered
seas. When it needs to breathe, it punches
a hole through the ice with the sharply
protruding section of its head.

DEWGONG.description:
It loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice.
The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on
a glacier was mistakenly thought to be
a mermaid by a mariner long ago.

GRIMER.description:
Born from polluted sludge in the sea,
Grimer's favorite food is anything filthy.
They feed on wastewater pumped out from
factories.

ALOLA.description:
There are a hundred or so of them living
in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all
hard workers who eat a lot of trash. Grimer
seems to relish any and all kinds of trash.

MUK.description:
It prefers warm and humid habitats.
In the summertime, the toxic substances
in its body intensify, making Muk reek like
putrid kitchen garbage.

ALOLA.description:
While it's unexpectedly quiet and friendly,
if it's not fed any trash for a while,,
it will smash its Trainer's furnishings,
and eat up the fragments.

SHELLDER.description:
At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor
with its broad tongue to make a place to
sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell,
but leaves its tongue hanging out.

CLOYSTER.description:
It swims in the sea by swallowing water,
then jetting it out toward the rear.
The Cloyster shoots spikes from its
shell using the same system.

GASTLY.description:
When exposed to a strong wind, a Gastly's
gaseous body quickly dwindles away.
They cluster under the eaves of houses
to escape the ravages of wind.

HAUNTER.description:
If a Haunter beckons you while it is
floating in darkness, don't approach it.
This Pokémon will try to lick you with its
tongue and steal your life away.

GENGAR.description:
Deep in the night, your shadow cast by
a streetlight may suddenly overtake you.
It is actually a Gengar running past
you, pretending to be your shadow.

MEGA.description:
Gengar's relationships are warped. It
tries to take the lives of anyone and
everyone. It will even try to curse the
Trainer who is its master!

GMAX.description:
Rumor has it that its gigantic
mouth leads not into its body, filled
with cursed energy, but instead
directly to the afterlife.

ONIX.description:
There is a magnet in its brain that
prevents an Onix from losing direction
while tunneling. As it grows older, its body
becomes steadily rounder and smoother.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_2_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_STEELIX, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_METAL_COAT})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_METAL_COAT, SPECIES_STEELIX})
#endif

STEELIX.description:
Steelix live even further underground
than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig
toward the earth's core, reaching a depth
of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

MEGA.description:
The cells within its body, crystallized by
the energy produced from Mega Evolution,
are stronger than any mineral and able
to withstand any temperature.

DROWZEE.description:
If your nose becomes itchy while you are
sleeping, it's a sure sign that a Drowzee is
standing above your pillow and trying to
eat your dream through your nostrils.

HYPNO.description:
The arcing movement and glitter of the
pendulum in a Hypno's hand lull the foe
into deep hypnosis. While searching for
prey, it polishes the pendulum.

KRABBY.description:
Krabby live in holes dug into beaches.
On sandy shores with little in the way
of food, they can be seen squabbling with
each other over territory.

KINGLER.description:
It waves its huge, oversized claw in the
air to communicate with others.
But since the claw is so heavy, this
Pokémon quickly tires.

GMAX.description:
The flow of Gigantamax energy has
spurred this Pokémon's left pincer
to grow to an enormous size. That
claw can pulverize anything.

VOLTORB.description:
It bears an uncanny and unexplained
resemblance to a Poké Ball. Because it
explodes at the slightest shock, even
veteran Trainers treat it with caution.

HISUI.description:
It resembles an ancient Poké Ball design.
When excited, it discharges the electric
current it has stored in its belly, then
lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

ELECTRODE.description:
They appear in great numbers at electric
power plants. Because they feed on
electricity, they cause massive and
chaotic blackouts in nearby cities.

HISUI.description:
The tissue on the surface of its body is
similar in composition to an Apricorn.
When irritated, it lets loose an electric
current equal to 20 lightning bolts.

EXEGGCUTE.description:
It consists of six eggs that care for each
other. The eggs attract each other and
spin around. When cracks increasingly
appear, it is close to evolution.

EXEGGUTOR.description:
Originally from the tropics, Exeggutor's
heads grow larger from exposure to strong
sunlight. It is said that when the heads
fall, they group to form an Exeggcute.

ALOLA.description:
Alola is the best environment for
this Pokémon. Local people take pride
in its appearance, saying this is how
Exeggutor ought to look.

CUBONE.description:
It pines for the mother it will never see
again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in
the full moon, it cries. The stains on the
skull it wears are from its tears.

MAROWAK.description:
A Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone
that has grown tough by overcoming the
grief of losing its mother. Its tempered
and hardened spirit is not easily broken.

TYROGUE.description:
Tyrogue become stressed out if they do
not get to train every day. When raising
this Pokémon, the Trainer must establish
a regular training schedule.

HITMONLEE.description:
Its legs freely stretch and contract.
Using these springlike limbs, it bowls over
foes with devastating kicks. After battle,
it rubs down its tired legs.

HITMONCHAN.description:
A Hitmonchan is said to possess the
spirit of a boxer who aimed to become the
world champion. Having an indomitable
spirit means that it will never give up.

HITMONTOP.description:
Its technique of kicking while spinning is
a remarkable mix of both offense and
defense. Hitmontop travel faster
spinning than they do walking.

LICKITUNG.description:
Whenever it sees something unfamiliar,
it always licks the object because it
memorizes things by texture and taste.
It is somewhat put off by sour things.

LICKILICKY.description:
The long tongue is always soggy with
slobber. The saliva contains a solvent
that causes numbness. Getting too close
to it will leave you soaked with drool.

KOFFING.description:
Getting up close to a Koffing will give
you a chance to observe, through its thin
skin, the toxic gases swirling inside. It
blows up at the slightest stimulation.

WEEZING.description:
By diluting its toxic gases with a special
process, the highest grade of perfume can
be extracted. To Weezing, gases emanating
from garbage are the ultimate feast.

GALAR.description:
Long ago, when droves of factories fouled
the air with pollution, it changed into this
form for some reason. It consumes air
pollutant particles, expelling clean air.

RHYHORN.description:
Once it starts running, it doesn't stop.
Its tiny brain makes it so stupid that it
can't remember why it started running in
the first place.

RHYDON.description:
Its horn, which rotates like a drill,
destroys tall buildings with one strike.
It stands on its hind legs, and its brain
is well developed.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_4_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_RHYPERIOR, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_PROTECTOR})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_PROTECTOR, SPECIES_RHYPERIOR})
#endif

RHYPERIOR.description:
It can launch a rock held in its hand
like a missile by tightening and then
expanding its muscles instantaneously.
Geodude are shot at rare times.

HAPPINY.description:
It carries a round white rock in its
belly pouch. If it gets along well with
someone, it will sometimes give that
person the rock.

CHANSEY.description:
Chansey lay nutritionally excellent eggs
every day. The eggs are so delicious, they
are eagerly devoured by even those people
who have lost their appetite.

BLISSEY.description:
If it senses sadness with its fluffy fur,
a Blissey will rush over to the sad person,
however far away, to share an egg of
happiness that brings a smile to any face.

TANGELA.description:
Its vines snap off easily and painlessly
if they are grabbed, allowing it to make a
quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced
by new growth the very next day.

TANGROWTH.description:
It ensnares prey by extending arms made
of vines. Even if one of its arms is eaten,
it's fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly
and will go right back to normal.

KANGASKHAN.description:
If you come across a young Kangaskhan
playing by itself, never try to catch it.
The baby's parent is sure to be in the area,
and it will become violently enraged.

MEGA.description:
When the mother sees the back of her
Mega-Evolved child, it makes her think
of the day when her child will inevitably
leave her.

HORSEA.description:
By cleverly flicking the fins on its back
side to side, it moves in any direction
while facing forward. It spits ink to
escape if it senses danger.

SEADRA.description:
The poisonous barbs all over its body are
highly valued as ingredients for making
traditional herbal medicine. It shows no
mercy to anything approaching its nest.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_2_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_KINGDRA, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_DRAGON_SCALE})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_DRAGON_SCALE, SPECIES_KINGDRA})
#endif

KINGDRA.description:
It sleeps quietly, deep on the seafloor.
When it comes up to the surface, it
creates a huge whirlpool that can swallow
even ships.

GOLDEEN.description:
In the springtime, schools of Goldeen
can be seen swimming up falls and rivers.
It metes out staggering damage with its
single horn.

SEAKING.description:
It punches holes in boulders on stream-
beds. This is a clever innovation that
prevents its eggs from being attacked or
washed away by the current.

STARYU.description:
It gathers with others in the night and
makes its red core glow on and off with
the twinkling stars. It can regenerate
limbs if they are severed from its body.

STARMIE.description:
People in ancient times imagined that
Starmie were transformed from the
reflections of stars that twinkled on
gentle waves at night.

MEGA.description:
Its movements have become more
humanlike. Whether it's simply
trying to communicate or wants to
supplant humanity is unclear.

MIME_JR.description:
In an attempt to confuse its enemy,
it mimics the enemy's movements.
Once mimicked, the foe cannot take
its eyes off this Pokémon.

MR_MIME.description:
A Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. It can
convince others that something unseeable
actually exists. Once believed, the
imaginary object does become real.

GALAR.description:
Its talent is tap-dancing. It can radiate
chilliness from the bottoms of its feet to
to create a floor of ice, which this
Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.

MR_RIME.description: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It\nwaves its cane of ice in time with its\ngraceful movements.

SCYTHER.description:
Its blindingly fast speed adds to the
sharpness of its twin forearm scythes.
The scythes can slice through thick logs
in one wicked stroke.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_2_CROSS_EVOS || P_GEN_8_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION(
                            #if P_GEN_2_CROSS_EVOS
                                {EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_SCIZOR, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_METAL_COAT})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_METAL_COAT, SPECIES_SCIZOR}
                            #if P_GEN_8_CROSS_EVOS
                                ,
                            #endif
                            #endif
                            #if P_GEN_8_CROSS_EVOS
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_BLACK_AUGURITE, SPECIES_KLEAVOR}
                            #endif
                            )
#endif#endif#endif#endif

SCIZOR.description:
A Scizor has a body with the hardness of
steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary
sorts of attacks. It flaps its wings to
regulate its body temperature.

MEGA.description:
The excess energy that bathes this
Pokémon keeps it in constant danger of
overflow. It can't sustain a battle over
long periods of time.

KLEAVOR.description:
A violent creature that fells trees with
its crude axes and shields itself with hard
stone. Should one encounter this Pokémon
in the wild, one's only recourse is to flee.

SMOOCHUM.description:
It actively runs about, but also falls
often. Whenever it falls, it will check its
reflection on a lake's surface to make
sure its face hasn't become dirty.

JYNX.description:
A Jynx sashays rhythmically as if it were
dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly
alluring, people seeing it are compelled to
shake their hips without noticing.

ELEKID.description:
If it touches metal and discharges the
electricity it has stored in its body, an
Elekid begins swinging its arms in circles
to recharge itself.

ELECTABUZZ.description:
When a storm approaches, it competes with
others to scale heights that are likely to
be stricken by lightning. Some towns use
Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_4_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_ELECTIVIRE, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_ELECTIRIZER})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_ELECTIRIZER, SPECIES_ELECTIVIRE})
#endif

ELECTIVIRE.description:
When it gets excited, it thumps its chest.
With every thud, thunder roars, electric
sparks shower all around and blue sparks
begin to crackle between its horns.

MAGBY.description:
If a Magby is spouting yellow flames from
its mouth, it is in good health. When it is
fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with
the flames.

MAGMAR.description:
In battle, it blows out intense flames from
all over its body to intimidate its foe.
These fiery bursts create heat waves that
ignite grass and trees in the area.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_4_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_MAGMORTAR, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_MAGMARIZER})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_MAGMARIZER, SPECIES_MAGMORTAR})
#endif

MAGMORTAR.description:
According to what is known, a single pair
of male and female Magmortar lives in
one volcano. From its arm, it launches
fireballs hotter than 3,600ºF.

PINSIR.description:
Their pincers are strong enough to
shatter thick logs. Because they dislike
cold, Pinsir burrow and sleep under
the ground on chilly nights.

MEGA.description:
The influence of Mega Evolution leaves it
in a state of constant excitement.
It pierces enemies with its two large
horns before shredding them.

TAUROS.description:
It is not satisfied unless it is rampaging
at all times. If there is no opponent for
Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick
trees and knock them down to calm itself.

PALDEA_COMBAT.description:
This Pokémon has a muscular body
and excels at close-quarters combat.
It uses its short horns to strike
the opponent’s weak spots.

PALDEA_BLAZE.description:
When heated by fire energy, its horns can
get hotter than 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
Those gored by them will suffer
both wounds and burns.

PALDEA_AQUA.description:
This Pokémon blasts water from holes on
the tips of its horns--the high-pressure
jets pierce right through
Tauros’s enemies.

MAGIKARP.description:
Its swimming muscles are weak, so it is
easily washed away by currents. In places
where water pools, you can see many
Magikarp deposited there by the flow.

GYARADOS.description:
It is an extremely vicious and violent
Pokémon. When humans begin to fight,
it will appear and burn everything to the
ground with intensely hot flames.

MEGA.description:
Although it obeys its instinctive drive to
destroy everything within its reach, it
will respond to orders from a Trainer it
truly trusts.

LAPRAS.description:
People have driven Lapras almost to the
point of extinction. In the evenings,
it is said to sing plaintively as it seeks
what few others of its kind still remain.

GMAX.description:
Over 5,000 people can ride on its
shell at once. And it's a very
comfortable ride, without the slightest
shaking or swaying.

DITTO.description:
A Ditto rearranges its cell structure to
transform itself. However, if it tries to
change based on its memory, it will get
details wrong.

GMAX.description:
Having gotten even friendlier and
more innocent, Eevee tries to play
with anyone around, only to end up
crushing them with its immense body.

VAPOREON.description:
Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous
mutation and grew fins and gills that
allow them to live underwater. They have
the ability to freely control water.

JOLTEON.description:
Its cells generate weak power that is
amplified by its fur's static electricity
to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is
made of electrically charged needles.

FLAREON.description:
Flareon's fluffy fur releases heat into
the air so that its body does not get
excessively hot. Its body temperature can
rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees F.

ESPEON.description:
An Espeon is extremely loyal to any
Trainer it considers to be worthy. It is
said to have developed precognitive
powers to protect its Trainer from harm.

UMBREON.description:
Umbreon evolved from exposure to the
moon's energy pulses. It lurks in darkness
and waits for its foes to move. The rings
on its body glow when it leaps to attack.

LEAFEON.description:
Its cellular composition is closer to
that of a plant than an animal. It uses
photosynthesis to produce its energy
supply without eating food.

GLACEON.description:
It can control its body temperature
at will. This enables it to freeze the
moisture in the atmosphere, creating
flurries of diamond dust.

SYLVEON.description:
Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura
that weakens hostility in its prey, causing
them to let down their guard. A moment
later, it pounces.

PORYGON.description:
It is capable of reverting itself entirely
back to program data in order to enter
cyberspace. A Porygon is copy-
protected so it cannot be duplicated.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_2_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_PORYGON2, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_UPGRADE})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_UPGRADE, SPECIES_PORYGON2})
#endif

PORYGON2.description:
It was created by humans using the power
of science. It has been given artificial
intelligence that enables it to learn new
gestures and emotions on its own.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_4_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_TRADE, 0, SPECIES_PORYGON_Z, CONDITIONS({IF_HOLD_ITEM, ITEM_DUBIOUS_DISC})},
                                {EVO_ITEM, ITEM_DUBIOUS_DISC, SPECIES_PORYGON_Z})
#endif

PORYGON_Z.description:
In order to create a more advanced
Pokémon, an additional program was
installed, but apparently it contained a
defect that made it move oddly.

OMANYTE.description:
One of the ancient and long-since-extinct
Pokémon that have been regenerated
from fossils by humans. If attacked,
it withdraws into its hard shell.

OMASTAR.description:
An Omastar uses its tentacles to capture
its prey. It is believed to have become
extinct because its shell grew too large,
making its movements slow and ponderous.

KABUTO.description:
It is a Pokémon that has been regenerated
from a fossil. However, in rare cases, living
examples have been discovered. Kabuto
have not changed for 300 million years.

KABUTOPS.description:
Kabutops once swam underwater to hunt 
for prey. It was apparently evolving from
being a water dweller to living on land as
evident from changes in its gills and legs.

AERODACTYL.description:
Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age
of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from DNA
extracted from amber. It is imagined to
have been the king of the skies.

MEGA.description: The power of Mega Evolution has\ncompletely restored its genes. The rocks\non its body are harder than diamond.

MUNCHLAX.description:
When it finds something that looks like
it might be edible, it goes right ahead
and swallows it whole. That's why it gets
fatter day by day.

SNORLAX.description:
Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing
more than eating and sleeping. It is such
a docile Pokémon that there are children
who use its big belly as a place to play.

GMAX.description:
Gigantamax energy has affected
stray seeds and even pebbles that
got stuck to Snorlax, making them grow
to a huge size.

ARTICUNO.description:
Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that
can control ice. The flapping of its wings
chills the air. As a result, it is said that
when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.

GALAR.description:
It fires beams that immobilize opponents
as if they had been frozen solid.
Its feather-like blades of psychic energy
rip through thick iron sheets like paper.

ZAPDOS.description:
Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that
has the ability to control electricity.
It usually lives in thunderclouds. It gains
power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

GALAR.description:
When its feathers rub together, they
produce a crackling sound like the
zapping of electricity. Apparently, it runs
through the mountains at over 180 mph.

MOLTRES.description:
Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon
that can control fire. If injured, it is said
to dip its body in the molten magma of
a volcano to burn and heal itself.

GALAR.description:
This Pokémon's sinister, flame-like aura
will consume the spirit of any creature
it hits. Victims become burned-out
shadows of themselves.

DRATINI.description:
A Dratini continually molts and sloughs
off its old skin. It does so because the
life energy within its body steadily builds
to reach uncontrollable levels.

DRAGONAIR.description:
A Dragonair stores an enormous amount of
energy inside its body. It is said to alter
the weather around it by loosing energy
from the crystals on its neck and tail.

DRAGONITE.description:
It can circle the globe in just 16 hours.
It is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads
lost and foundering ships in a storm
to the safety of land.

MEGA.description:
Mega Evolution has excessively
powered up this Pokémon's feelings
of kindness. It finishes off its
opponents with mercy in its heart.

MEWTWO.description:
A Pokémon that was created by genetic
manipulation. However, even though the
scientific power of humans made its body,
they failed to give it a warm heart.

MEGA_X.description:
Psychic power has augmented its muscles.
It has a grip strength of one ton and can
sprint a hundred meters in two seconds
flat!

MEGA_Y.description:
Despite its diminished size, its mental
power has grown phenomenally. With a mere
thought, it can smash a skyscraper to
smithereens.

MEW.description:
A Mew is said to possess the genes of all
Pokémon. It is capable of making itself
invisible at will, so it entirely avoids
notice even if it approaches people.
